alert.note: Alert for Bell; Clay; Harlan; Knox; Leslie (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 25 at 7:39PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Harlan, Bell, central Knox, southwestern Letcher, Leslie, southeastern Perry and southeastern Clay Counties through 815 PM EDT... At 738 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Wendover to near Erose to Girdler. Movement was southeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Cutshin, Causey, Big Fork, Beverly, Cinda, Sandy Fork, Smilax, Daley, Chappell and Warbranch around 745 PM EDT. Big Rock, Yeaddiss, Leatherwood, Stony Fork Junction, Saylor, Napier, Spruce Pine and Slemp around 750 PM EDT. Pineville, Wallins Creek, Arthur, Coldiron, Cary, Tacky Town, Molus, Straight Creek, Wallsend and Arjay around 755 PM EDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
